data.title: Sky One joins Mile High club
data.meta_description: 8.45am: Sky One has commissioned a drama about the lives and loves of airline cabin crews dubbed "Sex and the City in the sky", writes Wale Azeez.
data.text:
Sky One has commissioned a drama about the lives and loves of airline cabin crews dubbed "Sex and the City in the sky".

Mile High will focus on a group of air hostesses and cabin attendants who share an apartment and "hotbunk", taking their flatmates' beds when they are away with work.

The 13 x 60-minute series is being made by Hewland International, the company behind long running Sky One football soap Dream Team.

Hewland managing director Jane Hewland described the drama, which will go out next year, as a "Sex in the City in the sky".

Ms Hewland is bringing in US writer Dianne Dixon to work on the series alongside UK writers. Ms Dixon has written for Ally McBeal producer David E Kelly on US dramas such as Sabrina The Teenage Witch and The Practice.

Ms Hewland and Cameron McAllister will co-executive produce the series, as part of a newly formed joint venture production company called Double Act.
